Package com.satvik.args

Class Argument

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.satvik.args.Argument

  • public class Argument
extends java.lang.Object
    This class describes a command line argument. It's raw form is a String, but can be parsed into other forms.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0, 04/08/2016
    Author:
    Satvik Saha

      java.lang.String getValue()
      This method returns the raw value of the Argument.
      <T> T getValue(Parser<T> parser)
      This method returns the value of the Argument, parsed using the Parser passed to it.
      <T> T getValue(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
      This method returns the value of the Argument, parsed into an Object of Class 'clazz'.

        This method returns the raw value of the Argument.

      • getValue

        public <T> T getValue(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
               throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        This method returns the value of the Argument, parsed into an Object of Class 'clazz'.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the target type to be returned
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class of the target type
        Returns:
        the value of the Argument, parsed into class 'clazz'
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - thrown if the parsing was unsuccessful
        Since:
        1.0

      • getValue

        public <T> T getValue(Parser<T> parser)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        This method returns the value of the Argument, parsed using the Parser passed to it.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the target type to be returned
        Parameters:
        parser - the parser which parses the raw value
        Returns:
        the value of the Argument, parsed by 'parser'
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - thrown if the parser throws an Exception
        Since:
        1.0
